subject: Re: [junit] Thanks but that still doesn't tell me how to implement JUnit
msgSnippet: ... No: the GUI is for running tests, not writing them. To write tests, you write Java code. Google JUnit guide for more details. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
messageBody:
scottchamilton wrote:
>
>
> Do I write my JAVA code in the IDEA environment and implement that?
> The idea is to use JUnit for unit testing. I read on one site where
> JUNit has a graphic user interface for implementing the test code.

No: the GUI is for running tests, not writing them. To write tests, you
write Java code. Google "JUnit guide" for more details.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
